apiClassifier.shortdesc: The Device3D class manages the main configuration, states and data processing.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The Device3D class manages the main configuration, states and data processing.

apiValue.shortdesc: Buffer used to store bones transformations.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Buffer used to store bones transformations.

apiValue.shortdesc: Current view matrix.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Current view matrix. This property is automatically seted during the rendereing process.

apiValue.shortdesc: Current rendering camera.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Current rendering camera. This property is automatically seted during the rendereing process.

apiValue.shortdesc: The default cull face mode to use when some material is created.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The default cull face mode to use when some material is created.

apiValue.shortdesc: The default destination factor to use when some material is created.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The default destination factor to use when some material is created.

apiValue.shortdesc: The default source factor to use when some material is created.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The default source factor to use when some material is created.

apiValue.shortdesc: The number of draw operations of the last frame.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The number of draw operations of the last frame.

apiValue.shortdesc: The ammount of frames rendered.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The ammount of frames rendered.

apiValue.shortdesc: Global matrix of current rendering object.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Global matrix of current rendering object. This property is automatically seted during the rendereing process.

apiValue.shortdesc: Inverse global matrix of current rendering object.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Inverse global matrix of current rendering object. This property is automatically seted during the rendereing process.

apiValue.shortdesc: The maximim number of bones per surface.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The maximim number of bones per surface. This value should not be changed if it is not really necesary, it could affect dramatically the performance and stability of the engine.

apiValue.shortdesc: The maximum texture size allowed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The maximum texture size allowed.

apiValue.shortdesc: The number of objects that was drawn on the last frame.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The number of objects that was drawn on the last frame.

apiValue.shortdesc: Current projection matrix.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Current projection matrix. This property is automatically seted during the rendereing process.

apiValue.shortdesc: Current scene.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Current scene. This property is automatically seted during the rendereing process.

apiValue.shortdesc: The number of triangles drawn on the last frame.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The number of triangles drawn on the last frame.

apiValue.shortdesc: Current view-projection matrix.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Current view-projection matrix. This property is automatically seted during the rendereing process.

apiValue.shortdesc: Current inverted view matrix.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Current inverted view matrix. This property is automatically seted during the rendereing process.

apiValue.shortdesc: Current world-view-projection matrix.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Current world-view-projection matrix. This property is automatically seted during the rendereing process.

apiValue.shortdesc: Current world-view matrix.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Current world-view matrix. This property is automatically seted during the rendereing process.

apiValue.shortdesc: Sets and returns the maximum number of bones per vertex (1 to 4).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Sets and returns the maximum number of bones per vertex (1 to 4). This property works as a global configuration, and should be defined before creating the scene.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The Input3D class manages keyboard and mouse inputs.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The Input3D class manages keyboard and mouse inputs.
Download example - 05 - keyboard input.zip

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Initializes the Input3D class. This method is automatically called when a new scene is created.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns 'true' all the time the specified key is being pressed.

apiParam.apiDesc: Code of the key to be tested.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns 'true' all the time the specified key is being pressed.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns 'true' if the specified key has been pressed.

apiParam.apiDesc: Code of the key to be tested.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns 'true' if the specified key has been pressed. Unlike the keyDown method, this method will return 'true' only in the first test. Then it will return 'false' until the key is released, thus avoiding repetitions.
Updates keyboard and mouse inputs. This method is automatically called by the scene.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a count of the number of detents the mouse wheel has rotated.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a count of the number of detents the mouse wheel has rotated.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns or sets whether the double-click detection mode is enabled.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns or sets whether the double-click detection mode is enabled. The default value is 'false'.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns the key code of the last pressed key.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns the key code of the last pressed key.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button is pressed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button is pressed.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been pressed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been pressed.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a number greater than zero when the mouse button is released after clicking.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a number greater than zero when the mouse button is released after clicking.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been double clicked.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been double clicked.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button is pressed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button is pressed.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been pressed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been pressed.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns whatever the mouse was moved.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns whatever the mouse was moved.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a number greater than zero when the mouse button is released after clicking.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a number greater than zero when the mouse button is released after clicking.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns the displacement of the mouse on the X axis starting from the position of the last frame.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns the displacement of the mouse on the X axis starting from the position of the last frame.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns the position of the mouse on the X axis.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns the position of the mouse on the X axis.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns the displacement of the mouse on the Y axis starting from the position of the last frame.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns the displacement of the mouse on the Y axis starting from the position of the last frame.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns the position of the mouse on the Y axis.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns the position of the mouse on the Y axis.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button is pressed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button is pressed.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been pressed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been pressed.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a number greater than zero when the mouse button is released after clicking.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a number greater than zero when the mouse button is released after clicking.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The Library3D class loads and manages the resources used by 3d objects.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The Library3D class loads and manages the resources used by 3d objects.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched if a call to load() results in a fatal error that terminates the download.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched if a call to load() results in a fatal error that terminates the download.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: This event occurs whenever the loading progress of the elements of a library is modified.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: This event occurs whenever the loading progress of the elements of a library is modified.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: This event occurs once the loading process of all the library elements has been completed.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: This event occurs once the loading process of all the library elements has been completed.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: This event occurs when the library has been updated.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: This event occurs when the library has been updated.

apiParam.apiDesc: The number of connections used for download at the same time.
Define if the library starts automatically to download the files when the first file is added.
Allow to fire events (progress and complete) after the first complete events. It can be used to load multiple packages.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds a new item to the library.

apiParam.apiDesc: Path or key to associate the item.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Adds a new item to the library. This method asociates the item instance to a key-path to be used with the getItem() method. Also adds the item to a collecion of items.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns an item instance previosuly associated to a path.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The item corresponding to the path, null othwrwise.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns an item instance previosuly associated to a path.
Start downloading. If autoStart propery was seted to true in the constructor, this method will be automatically called when loads the first file.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if was sucesful, false otherwise.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Loads a new item object. If the item can not be loaded inmediately (depending of the amount of available connections), it will be added to a queue to be load when connections are available.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes all items and clean all references.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes all items and clean all references.

apiValue.shortdesc: Allow to fire events (progress and complete) after the first complete event were dispatched.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Allow to fire events (progress and complete) after the first complete event were dispatched. It can be used to load multiple packages.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns the amount of bytes loaded.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns the amount of bytes loaded.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns the amount of bytes that will be loaded.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns the amount of bytes that will be loaded.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns a copy of the stored items.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns a copy of the stored items.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns the global progress of all the resources being currently loaded.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Returns the global progress of all the resources being currently loaded. Once the 'complete' event has been received, it will be set back to zero and a new progress stage will begin if new resources are loaded only if allowEventsAfterComplete is seted to true in the class constructor,
